sub_tasks.requirements: Patient Cohort Construction: Correctly identifies female inpatients aged 80-90 with a diagnosis of hepatic failure.
Gender Selection: Filters the patient cohort to include only females (p.gender = 'F').
Age Range Selection: Correctly calculates age at admission and filters for patients between 80 and 90 years old.
Hepatic Failure Diagnosis: Identifies patients with hepatic failure using relevant ICD-9 (571%, 572%, 573%) and ICD-10 (K70% through K76%) codes.
Medication Complexity Score Calculation: Accurately computes a custom medication complexity score based on medications administered within the first 7 days of admission.
7-Day Medication Window: Filters prescriptions to include only those administered within the first 7 days of the hospital admission.
Unique Drug Count: Correctly counts the number of distinct drugs (COUNT(DISTINCT drug)).
Unique Route Count: Correctly counts the number of distinct administration routes (COUNT(DISTINCT route)).
High-Risk Drug Class Count: Correctly identifies and counts distinct high-risk medication classes (anticoagulants, insulin, opioids).
Score Formula Implementation: Applies the specified weighted formula to calculate the final medication_complexity_score.
Outcome Metrics Calculation: Correctly calculates length of stay, in-hospital mortality, and 30-day readmission for each admission.
Length of Stay Calculation: Calculates the length of stay in days by finding the difference between discharge and admission times.
In-Hospital Mortality Identification: Correctly uses the 'hospital_expire_flag' to identify in-hospital mortality.
30-Day Readmission Logic: Uses a window function (LEAD) to identify the next admission and correctly determines if it occurred within 30 days of discharge.
Final Analytics and Reporting: Stratifies the cohort into tertiles based on the complexity score and reports aggregated outcomes for each tertile.
Tertile Stratification: Uses the NTILE(3) window function to stratify the cohort into three groups based on the medication complexity score.
Grouping by Tertile: Groups the final results by the calculated complexity_tertile.
Outcome Aggregation: Correctly calculates the average LOS, mortality rate, and readmission rate per tertile using AVG().
Output Formatting: Presents rates as percentages and rounds numerical outputs for clarity.
